channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Justice Dept. Struggled to Find Lawyers to Handle Maurene Comey Suit
item.description: Ms. Comey sued the Trump administration after she was abruptly fired over the summer, saying the action was retaliation. Federal attorneys in New York...

item.title: The government shutdown is over, but not everything is back to normal
item.description: President Trump signed a bill reopening the government Wednesday night, but it will take more than a day for some things to return to business as usua...

item.title: 'We need to get out of here': Trump's immigration crackdown is quietly reshaping where immigrants live in America
item.description: The Trump administration says that more than 1.6 million immigrants have self-deported. But there's also evidence of an internal migration from target...

item.title: In the Faroe Islands’ Soccer Team, the Players Also Have Day Jobs
item.description: The Faroe Islands, rugged green specks in the North Atlantic, are an underdog. Most of the guys on the team have day jobs.

item.title: Michelle Obama’s New Book Is a Historical Document Dressed Up as a Coffee-Table Tome
item.description: “The Look” should be studied by generations to come because of what it reveals not about fashion, but about politics.

item.title: Under Fire for Tucker Carlson Remarks, Think Tank Chief Pleads Ignorance
item.description: Kevin Roberts, under fire for defending Tucker Carlson’s interview with a white nationalist, said that he did not keep up with the news and that he ha...

item.title: As Shutdown Ends, When Will SNAP and Air Travel Be Back to Normal?
item.description: Some programs like SNAP could be restored within hours, while other effects could take longer to unravel.

item.title: Why home insurance is unaffordable, even in places without wildfires or hurricanes
item.description: Some of the country's highest home insurance prices are in the central U.S., a region generally considered to be protected from climate-driven disaste...

item.title: What new Epstein emails say. And, ACA subsidies in limbo
item.description: Details on the newly released emails from Jeffrey Epstein. And, the government shutdown has ended, but health insurance subsidies remain in limbo, wit...

item.title: If you're going to be kind to another human, today is the day to do it!
item.description: November 13 is World Kindness Day. Its goal is to encourage acts of kindness. (After all, one kind day is better than none.) Here's a look at the natu...

item.title: Juan Ponce Enrile, a Political Power in the Philippines, Dies at 101
item.description: A protégé of Ferdinand Marcos, he helped administer martial law for eight years before turning on his patron in the “People Power” uprising of 1986.

item.title: Man Accused of Running Southeast Asia Scam Compound Is Extradited to China
item.description: China and the United States say She Zhijiang, a Chinese-born businessman, ran a major scam compound in Myanmar. He was arrested in Bangkok in 2022.

item.title: A Man Took a Bus for a Joyride. Turns Out, He’s Not a Bad Driver.
item.description: The incident in Hamilton, Ontario, ended safely with an arrest and no injuries (and all fares paid).

item.title: In the Faroe Islands’ Soccer Team, the Players Also Have Day Jobs
item.description: The Faroe Islands, rugged green specks in the North Atlantic, are an underdog. Most of the guys on the team have day jobs.

item.title: Bird Flu Ravaged the World’s Largest Elephant Seal Population, Study Finds
item.description: After the H5N1 virus hit the remote island of South Georgia in 2023, more than 50,000 breeding females may have disappeared.
